title: on me by section 7(2) of the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 (No. 14 of 2014)
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Protected Disclosures Act 2014
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 

(Disclosure to Prescribed Persons) (Amendment) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited protected disclosure act 2014 (disclosure prescribed persons) (amendment) order 2023

title: on me by section 7(2) of the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 (No. 14 of 2014)
heading: 2. The Schedule to the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 (Disclosure to
text_raw:
2. The Schedule to the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 (Disclosure to 

Prescribed Persons) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 367 of 2020) is amended – 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following for reference number 4: 

“4 

The chairperson 
of Coimisiún na 
Meán 

(a) All matters relating to the 
licensing by Coimisiún na Meán 
of the broadcasting sector and the 
monitoring by Coimisiún na Meán 
of all licensed services to ensure 
that licence holders comply with 
their statutory obligations and the 
terms of their licences issued 
under the Broadcasting Act 2009 
(No. 18 of 2009). 

(b) All matters relating to the 
development by Coimisiún na 
Meán of media service codes and 
media service rules made under 
Part 3B of the Broadcasting Act 
2009 (No. 18 of 2009). 

(c) All matters relating to the 
development by Coimisiún na 
Meán of online safety codes made 
under Part 8A of the Broadcasting 
Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009). 

(d) All matters falling within the 
remit of Coimisiún na Meán under 
Part 8B of the Broadcasting Act 
2009 (No. 18 of 2009).”, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 3rd November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 (b) by the substitution of the following for reference number 11: 

[524] 3 

“11 

The 
Commissioner for 
Railway 
Regulation 

(a) All matters relating to the 
regulation of railway safety in the 
State including matters relating to 
railway and cableway safety on 
passenger carrying systems and 
freight carrying systems where 
those systems interface with 
public roads. 

(b) All matters relating to the 
market surveillance for cableway 
subsystems and components. 

(c) All matters within the remit of 
the Commission for Railway 
Regulation relating to the 
regulation of the transportation of 
dangerous goods by rail.”, 

(c) 

in column (3) opposite reference number 13 by the substitution 
of “All matters falling within the remit of the Competition and 
Consumer Protection Commission relating to – 

(a) 

the enforcement of consumer protection law, 

(b) 

competition law, 

breaches of Regulation (EU) 2022/1925 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 14 September 20221 on 
contestable and fair markets in the digital sector and 
amending Directives (EU) 2019/1937 and (EU) 2020/1828 
(Digital Markets Act), and 

the review of mergers or acquisitions notified to the 
Competition and Consumer Protection Commission.” 

(c) 

(d) 

for 

“All matters falling within the remit of the Commission relating 
to the enforcement of consumer protection law, competition law 
and the review of mergers or acquisitions notified to the 
Commission.”, 

(d) by the substitution of the following for reference number 16: 

“16 The Chief 
Executive 
Officer of the 
Corporate 
Enforcement 
Authority 

All matters relating to the functions of 
the Corporate Enforcement Authority 
under section 944D of the Companies 
Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014).” , 

1 OJ No. L265, 12.10.2022, p. 1 

 
 
 4 [524] 

(e) 

in column (3) opposite reference number 28 by the substitution 
of 

“(a) All matters relating to the planning and development of 

higher education and research in the State. 

(b) All matters relating to funding for designated institutions 
of higher education within the meaning of section 53(1)(a) 
of the Higher Education Authority Act 2022 (No. 31 of 
2022).” 

for 

“(a) All matters relating to the planning and development of 

higher education and research in the State. 

(b) All matters relating to funding for universities and certain 
institutions of higher education designated under the 
Higher Education Authority Act 1971 (No. 22 of 1971).”, 

(f) 

by the deletion of reference number 40, 

(g) by the substitution of the following for reference number 48: 

“48 The Chief 
Executive 
Officer of the 
National 
Standards 
Authority of 
Ireland 

(a) All matters relating to the 
development, publication and 
dissemination of national, European 
and international standards. 

(b) All matters associated with 
product, practice and process 
certification carried out by the 
National Standards Authority of 
Ireland. 

(c) All matters relating to 
implementation and enforcement by or 
under the Metrology Acts 1980 to 
1998 and the Legal Metrology 
(Measuring Instruments) Act 2017 
(No. 31 of 2017). 

(d) All matters relating to the 
functions of the Director of Legal 
Metrology conferred by or under the 
Metrology Act 1996 (No. 27 of 1996). 

(e) All matters relating to certification 
and inspection functions conferred on 
the National Standards Authority of 
Ireland or the Director of Legal 
Metrology by regulations made under 
the European Communities Act 1972 
(No. 27 of 1972).”, 

 
 
 [524] 5 

(h) by the deletion of reference number 58, 

(i) 

(j) 

by the deletion of reference number 60, 

in column (2) opposite reference number 69 by the substitution 
of “The Chief Executive Officer of the Road Safety Authority” 
for “The Director of Corporate Services in the Road Safety 
Authority”, and 

(k) by the insertion of the following reference number after 

reference number 80: 

“81 The Chief 

Executive Officer 
of the Approved 
Housing Bodies 
Regulatory 
Authority 

All matters relating to the 
regulation of approved housing 
bodies pursuant to the Housing 
(Regulation of Approved Housing 
Bodies) Act 2019 (No. 47 of 
2019).”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 October, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [524] 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR 
Le ceannach díreach ó 
FOILSEACHÁIN RIALTAIS, 
BÓTHAR BHAILE UÍ BHEOLÁIN, 
CILL MHAIGHNEANN, 
BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 8, 
D08 XAO6 

Teil: 046 942 3100 
r-phost: publications@opw.ie

KILMAINHAM, DUBLIN 8, 
D08 XAO6 

Tel: 046 942 3100 
E-mail: publications@opw.ie
